perturbation.original_text:
AFFILIATE

        A company in which not less than either ten percent (10%) or the highest         percentage  allowed by the local law,  whichever  is the lowest,  of its         voting  capital is owned  directly or indirectly by a Party or a company         owning  directly  or  indirectly  not less than  either ten (10%) or the         highest percentage allowed by the local law, whichever is the lowest, of         the voting capital of a Party.
perturbation.changed_text:
AFFILIATE

        A company in which not less than either ten percent (10%) or the highest percentage  allowed by the local law, whichever is the lowest, of its voting capital is owned directly or indirectly by a Party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines 'Affiliate' based on ownership percentage by a party, or a company owning shares of that party. The modified text removes the condition about a company owning shares of that party and makes definition ambiguous.

perturbation.original_text:
PURCHASER

      An assignee of capacity,  including a Party,  obtaining TAT-14 capacity by       means of a Purchase  Contract and in  possession  of any and all requisite       licenses for the provision of international telecommunications.
perturbation.changed_text:
PURCHASER

      An assignee of capacity,  including a Party,  obtaining TAT-14 capacity by       means of a Purchase  Contract.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that a 'Purchaser' must have all requisite licenses for telecommunications. The modified text removes the license requirement, creating uncertainty about who qualifies as a 'Purchaser'.

perturbation.original_text:
MAINTENANCE AUTHORITIES

      The Maintenance Authorities in TAT-14 shall be the Terminal Parties.
perturbation.changed_text:
MAINTENANCE AUTHORITIES

      The Maintenance Authorities in TAT-14 shall be a group of individuals appointed by the Managing Group.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly defines Maintenance Authorities as Terminal Parties. The modified text changes this definition to a group appointed by the Managing Group, creating contradiction and uncertainty about who holds maintenance responsibilities.
